intro: Distictella chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan distictella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
